intro: Lomatogonium zhongdianense, commonly known as the Zhongdian lomatogonium, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are small, yellowish, and arranged in a compact cluster. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential medicinal properties.
